required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Role of Beta Trace Protein Assay During Spinal Anesthesia of Cesarean Section

brief_summary.textblock: Beta trace protein assay is an indicator of post-spinal CSF leak that predicts the degree of post-spinal headache.

detailed_description.textblock: Beta trace protein is specific for CSF only and it is a quantitative analytic test.

primary_outcome.description: After insertion of an intravenous line 4 ml serum will be collected, then 0.5 ml CSF sample will be collected after insertion of the dura by the selected spinal needle before injecting the anesthetic drugs used for spinal anesthesia. Beta trace protein assay will be measured through ELISA technique in both CSF and serum samples and the ratio will be calculated and measured. This ratio will be measured for the three arms aiming at the comparison between the three devices regarding the CSF : Serum ratio.

arm_group.description: It is a device used to penetrate the dura to take CSF sample before injecting the drugs used for spinal anesthesia for cesarean section.
It is a device used to penetrate the dura to take CSF sample before injecting the drugs used for spinal anesthesia for cesarean section.

intervention.description: It is a spinal needle with 'QUINCKE' Bevel. It is inserted in the lumbar region at the inter-space L4-L5, L4-L3 ,or L3-L2 lumber spaces, while the patient is put in the sitting position then CSF sample is taken then 2.5 ml of a local anesthetic(0.5 ml of 25 ug fentanyl and 2 ml of 8 mg heavy bupivacaine) is given intrathecal then the needle is withdrawn.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-45 years old
- free medical history.
- free obstetric history.
Exclusion Criteria:
- high risk pregnancy.
